Key Arguments: The legislation poses a threat to freedom of speech.
There is concern about who decides what constitutes misinformation and disinformation, especially in a multicultural society.
Governments and organizations like ACMA should promote free and open dialogue rather than control ideas.
Existing laws and policing are sufficient to handle universally dangerous practices.
Notable Quotes: It gives too much opportunity to restrict freedom of speech, and to do so from the perspective of the ruling culture or the dominant culture.
We do not need a government or any so-called independent body to paternalistically decide our ideas for us.
